# The Call Sites and Invocations Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Functions in this group apply to instructions that refer to call sites and invocations. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Functions in this group apply to instructions that refer to call sites and invocations.

These correspond to C++ types in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">llvm::CallInst</a> class tree.

<SectionDefinition>

### LLVMGetCalledValue() {#ga2b096f7e9f557ffc15fd8ad8ad10516b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMValueRef LLVMGetCalledValue (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Instr)</>}>
Obtain the pointer to the function invoked by this instruction.

This expects an <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> that corresponds to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">llvm::CallInst</a> or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/invokeinst">llvm::InvokeInst</a>.

</SectionUser>

### LLVMGetInstructionCallConv() {#ga486514fe0008cf892521d87ec20e6daa}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned LLVMGetInstructionCallConv (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Instr)</>}>
Obtain the calling convention for a call instruction.

This is the opposite of <a href="#ga641adb8ed25ac476842eb680f05b8ae3">LLVMSetInstructionCallConv()</a>. Reads its usage.

### LLVMGetNormalDest() {#gab294ff7431df4ea9e83cd912fd9de0ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMBasicBlockRef LLVMGetNormalDest (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> InvokeInst)</>}>

This only works on <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/invokeinst">llvm::InvokeInst</a> instructions.

### LLVMGetNumArgOperands() {#ga41bf679e6209048d1e3436d017335a0c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned LLVMGetNumArgOperands (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Instr)</>}>
Obtain the argument count for a call instruction.

This expects an <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> that corresponds to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">llvm::CallInst</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/invokeinst">llvm::InvokeInst</a>, or llvm:FuncletPadInst.


<SectionUser title="See Also">

</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="See Also">

</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="See Also">

</SectionUser>

</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetNumOperandBundles() {#ga61ca5188b65b338c98ecb9159a8d3d91}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned LLVMGetNumOperandBundles (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> C)</>}>

### LLVMGetOperandBundleAtIndex() {#ga074201382e222a8f63e94640ba5ba695}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMOperandBundleRef LLVMGetOperandBundleAtIndex (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> C, unsigned Index)</>}>
Obtain the operand bundle attached to this instruction at the given index.

Use LLVMDisposeOperandBundle to free the operand bundle.

This only works on <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callinst">llvm::CallInst</a> and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/invokeinst">llvm::InvokeInst</a> instructions.
